qas.question: How many Greek natural citizens are Catholic?
How many Roman Catholic immigrants are in Greece?
How many Protestants live in Greece?
How many churches does the biggest Protestant denomination have?
How many Jehovah's Witnesses are in Greece?

context: Greek citizens who are Roman Catholic are estimated to be at around <a0_0>50,000<a0_0/> with the Roman Catholic immigrant community in the country approximately <a1_0>200,000<a1_0/>. Old Calendarists account for 500,000 followers. Protestants, including Greek Evangelical Church and Free Evangelical Churches, stand at about <a2_0>30,000<a2_0/>. Assemblies of God, International Church of the Foursquare Gospel and other Pentecostal churches of the Greek Synod of Apostolic Church have 12,000 members. Independent Free Apostolic Church of Pentecost is the biggest Protestant denomination in Greece with <a3_0>120<a3_0/> churches. There are not official statistics about Free Apostolic Church of Pentecost, but the Orthodox Church estimates the followers as 20,000. The Jehovah's Witnesses report having <a4_0>28,874<a4_0/> active members. In recent years there has been a small-scale revival of the ancient Greek religion, with estimates of 2,000 people active practitioners, and 100,000 "sympathisers".
